citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A tri-colored Dachshund named "Lacey" (tag #062) is nursing a five day old puppy. During inspection, the puppy wasn't
moving around much. When asked, the licensee stated the puppy seemed to be thriving and doing well the first four days,
but she noticed that it wasn't moving around much last night. She stated the status hasn't seem to change from last night.
The licensee hasn't contacted the attending veterinarian and hasn't done anything to provide treatment to the puppy.
Not contacting the attending veterinarian on a nursing puppy that doesn't seem to be thriving over the past day could
result in the puppy getting sicker. A mechanism of direct and frequent communication is required so that timely and
accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being is conveyed to the attending veterinarian.
The attending veterinarian must be contacted and the puppy must be treated per his/her instructions. Correct starting on
11/20/25.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End of report.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A tri-colored Dachshund named "Lacey" (tag #062) is nursing a five day old puppy. During inspection, the puppy wasn't 
moving around much. When asked, the licensee stated the puppy seemed to be thriving and doing well the first four days, 
but she noticed that it wasn't moving around much last night. She stated the status hasn't seem to change from last night. 
The licensee hasn't contacted the attending veterinarian and hasn't done anything to provide treatment to the puppy. 
 
Not contacting the attending veterinarian on a nursing puppy that doesn't seem to be thriving over the past day could 
result in the puppy getting sicker. A mechanism of direct and frequent communication is required so that timely and 
accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being is conveyed to the attending veterinarian. 
The attending veterinarian must be contacted and the puppy must be treated per his/her instructions. Correct starting on 
11/20/25. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End of report. 
 
 n
